Emilia Clarke Reveals How Amber Heard Got the Part in Aquaman

INTRO: Ever since news broke that Johnny Depp and Amber Heard are getting a divorce after being married for only one year, scandal after scandal has managed to damage each other’s lives and reputation along the way.
With that being said, multiple accounts of abuse from Amber Heard have also surfaced through their court battles. And fans are now taking sides between the two spouses – even taking it to have the actress removed from the next Aquaman movie and they even have Emilia Clarke to fill the vacant role!
Hey guys, welcome back to our channel. Today we will be spilling the tea about what Emilia Clarke had to say about Amber Heard’s part in Aquaman. But before we move on, don’t forget to hit the like button. And if you’re new here, please do smash that subscribe button and ring the notification bell to stay in tune with our updates! Now, on to the video:
If you haven’t been living under a rock, you’ve probably heard all about the Johnny Depp and Amber Heard fiasco somewhere on the internet. It’s one narrative that has its twists and turns especially regarding the accusations the couple has made against each other. 
But to keep you refreshed, the pair have been dating for quite a while before eventually getting hitched together in a Los Angeles private ceremony in 2015. However, one year later, multiple sources have reported that Amber has officially filed for divorce from Johnny alongside a temporary restraining order on the grounds of physical abuse. She said that at the time of the divorce an incident took place wherein Johnny had lost control and threw his phone at her eventually leaving Amber bruised in her face. However, an insider had told People magazine that there were no investigations or proof that such a crime had taken place.
And while they have been officially separated since 2017, Heard took it to The Washington Post in 2018 to write an op-ed for speaking out about women and domestic abuse and Johnny did not take it lightly. 
“I became a public figure representing domestic abuse, and I felt the full force of our culture’s wrath for women who speak out,” she wrote in the article.
Johnny eventually sued Amber for $50 million for defamation over the said article. He stated that Amber was not a victim of domestic abuse but is rather a perpetrator and went on call the allegations as an “elaborate hoax to generate positive publicity” for Amber.
“The op-ed depended on the central premise that Ms. Heard was a domestic abuse victim and that Mr. Depp perpetrated domestic violence against her,” Johnny’s lawyers said.
In 2020, phone recordings of Amber blatantly admitting to having hit Johnny on multiple occasions.
“I don’t know what the motion of my actual hand was, but you’re fine, I did not hurt you, I did not punch you, I was hitting you,” she said in the phone call.
And as mentioned, the whole situation has been quite damaging for their careers as Johnny announced on Instagram in November 2020 that he has been asked to resign from his role as Grindelwald in the third “Fantastic Beasts” film – a role he had successfully been playing since 2017.
